events.name: Muther! of all Hackathons + WIPJam @ Mobile Moves Michigan
events.about:
We are stoked to be heading to Michigan for a WIPJam+ Muther! of all Hackathons. Make plans to join WIP and MTAM (the Mobile Technology Association of Michigan) at a great event in the Midwest.  Event will be held in conjunction with “Mobile Moves Michigan”, a Mobile Technology Symposium and Strategic Planning event. 

Monday, July 30 will be a WIPJam Day for Developers, featuring Unpanels, Discusion Groups, Storytellers and more.  And, as always, No PPT No Panels No Ties!

Monday will wrap with a networking reception and the start of the Muther! of all  Hackathon.   Tuesday will see the continuation of hacking, application pitching, judging, awards and prizes!

We are still seeking sponsors and speakers. Contact Teresa Ostman from WIP for more details.

events.name: MobiDevDay Detroit 2012
events.about:
SOLD OUT !!!
PLEASE ADD YOUR NAME TO THE
WAIT LIST. 
 
 
This year DetroitDevDays is trying something different.  DevDays will be smaller but more frequent.   We want to find ways to make this more of a learning experience for attendees.  MobiDevDay will be the first in this new series.  It is still a conference format, so there will be time to network and meet and greet.  We will take the best of past experience and merge it with our new vision to provide an exciting and more personalized learning opportunity.

MobiDevDay is dedicated to educating the local developer community about relevant mobile technologies and issues.   Only a limited number of tickets will be sold. There will be formal presentations throughout the day and hands on hacking and open spaces.   This will be a new kind of DevDay aimed at both teaching and entertaining. Android, iOS and the Mobile Web will all be represented. 

VERY EARLY BIRD TICKETS
 
The very early bird Tickets are now on sale.  Very early bird tickets are for folks who want to reserve their seat at MobiDevDay, while we are still in the working stages of producing this event. 
 
 
We cannot refund tickets after April 2nd.   It just cuts it too close. 

 
Call for Speakers - MobiDevDay Detroit 2012 - May 19th

MobiDevDay attendees are Software developers, programmers and software architects.  Some attendees will be exploring mobile technologies for the first time, other attendees are just coders who want to absorb all they can, and still others are already iOS or Android Developers.   Many come from years of java programming while others are still students at Wayne State or UofM.

We need presentations that are specific to key mobile technologies but also presentations that will cross boundaries. A presenter should plan for 40 to 45 minutes worth of slide material and 15 mins of questions.

Presenters willing to take time after, and possibly before, their talks answering questions and mentoring in the MobiDevDay open hacking area will be considered first.   

For example,  one presentation already proposed is Objective C for Java Developers. This presenter is excited about the opportunity to sit with attendees after his talk to help with projects and answer in-depth questions.

Where will MobiDevDay be held? May 19th has been reserved at the recently rescued and restored Madison in downtown Detroit.  We will use the Madisons auditorium for the formal presentations and the loft area just outside of the auditorium for hacking and open spaces.

Will there be free parking? Yes, if you park in the Detroit Opera House Parking Structure we can validate your parking.

 

 

Send your session proposals and ideas to mckinnon.david at ymail dot com.   Go tohttp://detroitdevdays.com to learn more.

events.name: Detroit  Startup Weekend 4
events.about:
EARLY BIRD TICKET SALES END ON JANUARY 18TH

Calling all hackers, hustlers, designers and future Zuckerbergs: Startup Weekend is coming back to Detroit. Lets do this thing and build some companies. Join us at the M@dison Building, the new home of Detroit Venture Partners, for one amazing weekend.

What does a ticket get you?

Seven meals

(Dinner on Friday - Breafast, Lunch and Dinner on Saturday and Sunday).

Access to incredible mentors and speakers

An opportunity to network with local hackers/hustlers

A chance to share your idea, build a team, create a prototype and pitch to a panel of experts in just one weekend.

 

Your Host


 

Sponsors



About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurs. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

 

Need some convincing? Watch these videos.

 

For all event details, visit detroit.startupweekend.org

Thanks!

Brandon and Henry

The Startup Weekend Detroit Crew

 

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.
events.address: Julian Madison Building LLC‎ 1420 Washington Boulevard
